items.preText: 6.42pm The night has set in, the flood lights have taken effect, and we should be good to start the chase in a few moments. Tough ask for Bangladesh, but their openers have been in good form. Zimbabwe's best chance to pick up a win on this tour. They've had a horrid last few weeks in ODIs. This is the ideal opportunity to set that right. Kyle Jarvis to start off. Tanvir Ahmed: "What an innings from Sean Williams.A real fightback from the Zimbweans after the initial collapse.Hats off to you.(I'm a die-hard Bangladeshi fan)" -- Would agree, though the positive is that Mashrafe Mortaza handed the ball to relatively inexperienced bowlers at the death, and Saifuddin and Hider between them conceded just seven off the last two overs. Akshay takes over with commentary for now. 6:32pm Moments away from the chase, where Bangladesh have to score 287 to secure a 3-0 series win here. Can they do this? Recent top order form is a positive sign for Mashrafe's men.
items.text: raps the pad straight away! Huge shout for lbw, given, but this seemed like it was heading down leg. Review promptly taken. Full, angling in, tries to flick and the ball misses the inside edge. Nothing on Ultra Edge. Umpire's call.. Clipping outside of leg stump
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, OUT

dismissal.text: Liton Das lbw b Jarvis 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.text: short of good length, angled across off, punched to mid-off
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: shortish and a bit of width, slashed through backward point
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: just back of a length, tight lines, tries to flick and gets an inside edge to the pad
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: back of a length, outside off, stands tall and punches to covers
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: back of a length, slanted across off, slaps it to cover who dives to his right and fields it
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: Here's Ngarava from the other end.
items.text: short, a bit of width, no pace as it comes on really slow and gets past the inside edge of his flashing bat
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: short of good length outside off, opens the face to deep point
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: short, wide, cut hard and cut past point flying to his left
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: defends this down the pitch towards mid-on
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: short of good length, angled in from outside off, shuffles across and blocks
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length ball angling into off, leans forward and blocks
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: short ball, angled across and giving him enough room to get on top of it and whack it away with a pull to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: short of a length, angled across, punched into the covers
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Chayon: "What is the highest successful run chase for Bangladesh in ODIs, Akshay?" -- 322 for 4 against Scotland in 2015.
items.text: good length outside off, drops it into the covers and is refused the single
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Ron: "Imrul is 31. I'd say he still has 4-5 good years in him. He has the talent, but you'd love to see him stamp his authority on international cricket. Not in glimpses, but consistently. "
items.text: slashes away from the body and gets an <b>outside edge that drops short of third man</b
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: rides the bounce of this back of a length delivery and carves it just over cover leaping back with his hands outstretched
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: belts out an appeal for lbw as he finds the pad. Not given. Jarvis seems to suggest there might have been an inside edge. Was it also too high? Inside edge confirmed by replays
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: flicks a fuller one off the pads to deep fine leg
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: short of length, drags a pull from outside off to mid-on
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, opens the face to deep backward point
items.shortText: Ngarava to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: another appeal for lbw, this one's half-hearted with the ball clearly sliding down leg
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: full, wide, inviting the batsman, and Sarkar accepts it with a neat stride forward before dispatching it between cover and extra cover
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length outside off, mistimes a pull to midwicket
items.shortText: Ngarava to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: slides a fullish length ball across, driven to extra cover
items.shortText: Jarvis to Soumya Sarkar, no run
